TopicTitle: International construction ISS in Kerbal orbit.

Articles.Content:
Oh, ok Have you already send Nauka ?

That module is not on the ISS pack iirc.

The ones I miss are the ones that haven't been released yet by anyone.

Edited June 7, 2013 by aftokinito
Use another Mir core for nauka for now.

Use another Mir core for nauka for now.

Good idea, will do.

What side should I dock to the ISS, the "fat" area or the "docking hub"?

Fat Area, look on a wikipedia image of the ISS, there are supposed to be/or I don't know maybe it's there were supposed to be, 4 nodes at the bottoms, for 2 for MRMs, a docking module, and something else (DONT CORRECT ME IF IM WRONG IM DOING THIS FROM MEMORY).

How did you build your Z1 truss? What are you using for the solar arrays for Zarya (and how can I get them)? Also, are you planning on releasing your Space Shuttle

Z1 is built with stock parts, just a bit of creative fun with structural panels. Zarya panels are from Kosmos SSPP, it's released in the releases forum. I really want to release the Space Shuttle, but some of the parts need Unity edits and I don't have the meshes. I'm still looking into obtaining them.
Alright, none of my mod docking ports work...what did I mess up when I installed bobcats stuff?
They are broken right now
Everything? Even the soviet stuff?
Apparently

Neither the Canadarm nor the Buran robotic arm are working for me; I'm trying to assemble the ISS so I need it. Can someone please tell me what I messed up in the file placement? Thanks.

Edited June 7, 2013 by Anthony Frushour
You can't ask for help without giving us any information that could lead us to the problem. Download the Lazor System Robotic Arms Pack and install all the plugins and such in game data.

They are broken right now

What dont work? Dock ports? All work exelent.

Sorry bobcat I was confused

I have 2 questions

What size is the CBMs port ?

And what is up with PMA?

Edited June 7, 2013 by DarthVader

You can't ask for help without giving us any information that could lead us to the problem. Download the Lazor System Robotic Arms Pack and install all the plugins and such in game data.

Ok, here's how my files are arranged:

<Game Data>

...<BobCatind>

.......<Flags>

.......<Parts>

.......<PluginData>

...........<romfarer>

.................<sounds>

.................<textures>

.......<Spaces>

.......AdvSAS.dll

.......KAS.dll

.......romfarer.dll

...<Romfarer>

.......<Parts>

.......<sounds>

.......<textures>

.......Romfarer.dll

Let me know if you need more, and sorry for the ambiguity.

What size is the CBMs port ?

5. CBM to CBM work perfect. No any other dockports support. Like IRL

And what is up with PMA?

PMA broken and bug spaming all other ports. Dont use them.

That module is not on the ISS pack iirc.

The ones I miss are the ones that haven't been released yet by anyone.

It is. Nauka was originally made as a backup for the original launch of the Zarya. So it looks exactly like Zarya. We have Zarya thus we have Nauka. The only thing we don't have are the solar panels (see Wcole we need the solar panels for Zarya )

PMA broken and bug spaming all other ports. Dont use them.

That's what I didn't know. Thanks!

It is. Nauka was originally made as a backup for the original launch of the Zarya. So it looks exactly like Zarya. We have Zarya thus we have Nauka. The only thing we don't have are the solar panels (see Wcole we need the solar panels for Zarya )

You can fix the node that's bugging me but I might've deleted the file with .19

Just checked it's gone and somewhere in unity. Plus it's, it was a static part.

you have two Romfarer.dll's... remove the one in Bobcatind folder.

and delete the bobcatind\pluginData\romfarer folder.

also, if you have the FULL KAS mod itself, the also delete the Bobcatind/kas.dll file.

Edited June 8, 2013 by Fyrem
Bobcat, but in the first post that ports a broken so people keep asking please.
is there an easy fix for the pma or is it a problem with the mesh?
No easy fix, we don't know the problem, devo, I suggest talking with a KSP Dev for a solution?
Devo, maybe when you changed from a 2 port design to a single port design, you forgot to remove/add a line of code. Or maybe it would be easier to start from scratch.

you have two Romfarer.dll's... remove the one in Bobcatind folder.

and delete the bobcatind\pluginData\romfarer folder.

also, if you have the FULL KAS mod itself, the also delete the Bobcatind/kas.dll file.
